commands.simplyhotsprings.locationinfo.c: Click to put in chat box
commands.simplyhotsprings.locationinfo.n: The biome at this location is unknown/unregistered!
commands.simplyhotsprings.biomeslist.all: All biomes known by Simply Hot Springs:
commands.simplyhotsprings.biomeslist.wit: Hot Springs CAN generate in the following biomes:
Hot Springs CANNOT generate in the following biomes:
commands.simplyhotsprings.biometypes.typ: Biome Dictionary Type '%s' cannot be found
commands.simplyhotsprings.biometypes.bio: All biomes in Biome Dictionary Type '%s':
commands.simplyhotsprings.biometypes.cli: Click to list biomes with this type
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.no_world_gen: The "World Generation" config option is false.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_name_whit: This biome is in the "Biome Name Whitelist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_name_blac: This biome is in the "Biome Name Blacklist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_type_blac: This biome has a type in the "Biome Type Blacklist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.in_type_whit: This biome has a type in the "Biome Type Whitelist".
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.empty_name_w: This biome wasn't excluded by any blacklists, and the "Biome Name Whitelist" is empty.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.empty_type_w: This biome wasn't excluded by any blacklists, and the "Biome Type Whitelist" is empty.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.not_whitelis: This biome was excluded by whitelists.
simplyhotsprings.gen.reason.configured_e: The Hot Spring configured feature failed to register! Report this bug!
simplyhotsprings.config.createsSources.t: If true, Hot Spring Water makes infinite water sources, like vanilla water does.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffect.too: The namespaced effect that Hot Spring Water applies to entities. If the given effect isn't found (or left blank), no effect is applied.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffectTime: The duration of the effect, in ticks. 20 ticks = 1 second.
simplyhotsprings.config.potionEffectAmpl: The amplifier of the effect. 0 is level 1.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.tooltip: Most of these settings require any open world to be closed and reopened.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.info.to:
The command "/simplyhotsprings locationinfo" will tell you the name and types of the biome you're currently in. Use those results to fill in your whitelists and blacklists. It will also tell you whether or not a Hot Spring can generate there, so you can use it for testing your whitelists and blacklists. 
(This config setting does nothing other than list all default biome types for your convenience, so put whatever you want in here.)
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.worldGe:
Set to false to stop Hot Springs from generating. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
The chance for a Hot Spring to generate is 1 over this value. So lower values are more likely. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.debug.t: When a Hot Spring generates in the world, prints the location to console.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.biomeTy:
The biome types where Hot Springs are allowed to generate. If empty, all biome types are allowed. 
The Biome Type Whitelist and Biome Name Whitelist are not both required to be satisfied. You can use a period as a dummy entry. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.

The biome types where Hot Springs are NOT allowed to generate. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
simplyhotsprings.config.worldgen.biomeNa:
The individual biomes where Hot Springs are allowed to generate. If empty, all biomes are allowed. 
The Biome Type Whitelist and Biome Name Whitelist are not both required to be satisfied. You can use a period as a dummy entry. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.

The individual biomes where Hot Springs are NOT allowed to generate. 
If you change this setting with a world open, it must be closed and reopened for the changes to take effect.
